1.text: And yet hear now, O Job, my speech, and give ear to all my words.

2.text: Behold, now, I opened my mouth, my tongue spake in my palate.

3.text: My sayings the uprightness of my heart, and my lips spake knowledge purely.

4.text: The spirit of God made me, and the breath of the Almighty will cause me to live.

5.text: If thou shalt be able to turn back to me, set in order before me, stand forth.

6.text: Behold, I am according to thy mouth for God: from clay was I also broken off.

7.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, and my hand shall not be heavy upon thee.

8.text: Surely thou spakest in mine ear and I will hear the voice of thy words.

9.text: I am clean without transgression; I am fair, and no iniquity to me.

10.text: Behold, he will find enmity against me, and he will reckon me for an enemy to him.

11.text: He will set my feet in the stocks, he will watch all my paths.

12.text: Behold, this thou wert not just: I will answer thee, for God will be great above man.

13.text: Wherefore didst thou contend against him? for he will not answer all his words.

14.text: For God will speak at once, and at a second time, and he shall not regard it.

15.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, in the falling of deep sleep upon men, in slumbers upon the bed;

16.text: Then he will uncover the ear of men, and will seal in their instruction,

17.text: To remove man from working, and he will bide pride from man.

18.text: He will keep back his soul from the pit, and his life from passing away by the spear.

19.text: And he was chastened with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones perpetually.

20.text: His life loathed bread, and his soul food of desire.

21.text: His flesh will consume away from seeing, and they saw not the nakedness of his bones.

22.text: And his soul will draw near to the pit, and his life to the dead.

23.text: If there is a messenger upon him, an interpreter, one from a thousand, to announce to man his uprightness:

24.text: And he will compassionate him and say, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I found an expiation.

25.text: His flesh revived above a youth: he shall turn back to the days of his childhood.

26.text: He shall pray to God and he shall receive him into favor: and he shall see his face with rejoicing, and he will turn back to man his justice.

27.text: He will look upon men, and he shall say, I sinned, and I perverted the right, and it was not fitting to me;

28.text: Redeem my soul from passing into the pit, and my life shall look upon light.

29.text: Behold, all these God will work twice, thrice, with man,

30.text: To turn back his soul from the pit, to enlighten with the light of the living.

31.text: Attend, O Job, hear to me: be silent and I will speak.

32.text: If there be words, turn back to me: speak, for I desired to justify thee.

33.text: If not, hear thou to me: be silent, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
